This is a 4-month co-op position and projects may vary from season to season depending on business needs.


Please note that the deadline for applications is November 27, 2020.


Role Impact:

The Business Insights Analyst (Winter Co-Op) will sit within the Strategic Planning and Business Insights team at Cadillac Fairview, but may also work with other areas in the group. Given the current global pandemic, this role will be working from home, with in person meetings being optional. Should the situation change and full work from office resumes, the office is located at 20 Queen St W, Toronto, ON.


Reporting to the Manager, Business Insights, the Co-Op student may be responsible for the development of analysis and insights around retail and market performance, retail sales internally and in the industry. The ideal candidate will have the ability to integrate various internal and external sources of data, analyze, forecast, and interpret data sets and information to provide high-quality, actionable insights into Cadillac Fairview properties, current and potential retail tenants, and overall market trends.


The Strategic Planning & Insights team is an innovative corporate strategy group at Cadillac Fairview. It was established to develop strategies to maximize the long-term value of Cadillac Fairview’s portfolio and to champion Cadillac Fairview’s strategy to lead by insight. The SP&I Team is very visible at the executive level of Cadillac Fairview and is integral to and involved in all aspects of its business. The SP&I Team, which is part of the Investment Group, consists of three parts: (i) Strategic Asset Management, which is responsible for property level strategy; (ii) Market & Customer Insights, which is responsible for primary consumer and market insight, (iii) Strategic Planning & Business Insights which is responsible for strategy around industry developments and business analysis insights.


What you will deliver:

  • Help drive insights about potential or existing retail tenants, the retail industry, or competitors through analysis of secondary and primary research, within both recurring reporting as well as ad-hoc research projects. Project examples could include:

    • Assist in the development of key performance indicators and information support to help solve business problems and opportunities with potential and existing retail tenants assessing best fit to Cadillac Fairview properties.
    • Subject matter expert in market and retail analytics and insights as well as key systems, data sets and analytics approaches.
    • Industry secondary research in support of quarterly reporting.
    • Retailer specific research in support of a retailer risk program.
    • Competitive intelligence to understand what other real estate developers are implementing.
    • New visualizations or dashboards to help present information more effectively and accurately to all levels of the organization.
    • Ad-hoc queries to help aid in reporting requirements.
    • Solicit and audit information to ensure accuracy of presented data.
    • The individual may have the opportunity to work on other projects as they come up in support of the Strategic Planning & Insights team to gain exposure and experience given capacity.


What your strengths are:

  • You have excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • You also have strong interpersonal skills, strong attention to detail, strong organizational and prioritization skills.
  • You have the ability to work independently and on team projects, multi-task and manage priorities in a demanding and continually changing fast-paced environment.

  • You have demonstrated experience in data visualization tools such as Tableau.
  • You have strong analytical and problem solving skills with experience in working with databases, statistics, and other facets of market research.
  • You have experience in reporting and analysis of Sales, Marketing, Traffic or Category Management data.
  • You have experience with Microsoft Office, particularly with Excel and PowerPoint.

job_title: Machine Learning Intern, Speech Recognition, M.S. / Ph.D., Winter 2020-2021
description:
[[

Join one of our core speech technology teams for a 10 week (minimum) paid internship. Participation requires that you are located in Canada for the duration of the internship program.

In this role you will:

  • Apply deep learning techniques and neural networks to improve acoustic models for Automatic Speech Recognition
  • Innovate on state-of-the-art deep learning systems for speech recognition

We would love to hear from you if:

  • You are currently enrolled in a Master's or Ph.D. program in Computer Science or in a related quantitative discipline
  • You are available to work full-time for a minimum of 10 weeks outside of university term time
  • You have experience with modern machine learning techniques
  • You have experience with deep learning frameworks such as Caffe, TensorFlow, Torch, PyTorch, and MxNet
  • You take pride in your writing clean C++ or Python code in a Linux environment
  • You enjoy working with algorithms, probability, and statistics

We'd be especially excited if you are familiar with speech recognition, computer vision, or pattern recognition. Also, don't forget to mention if you are familiar with digital signal processing (DSP) principles, noise reduction, or echo cancelation.

At SoundHound Inc., we believe every brand should have a voice. As the leading innovator of conversational technologies, we're trusted by top brands around the globe. Houndify, our independent Voice AI platform, with 70,000+ users, allows brands to create custom voice assistants that deliver results with unprecedented speed and accuracy.

Our mission is to enable humans to interact with the things around them in the same way we interact with each other: by speaking naturally. We're making that a reality through our SoundHound music discovery app and Hound voice assistant and through our strategic partnerships with brands like Mercedes-Benz, Hyundai, Deutsche Telekom, and Pandora. Today, our customized voice AI solutions allow people to talk to phones, cars, smart speakers, mobile apps, coffee machines, and every other part of the emerging 'voice-first' world.

Our diverse team of engineers, UX/UI designers, writers, data scientists and linguists are all passionate about creating a world with more conversations. With more than 14 years of expertise in voice technology, we have hundreds of millions of end users, and a worldwide team in six countries building solutions for a voice-first world.

]]
